name: Type 1 Diabetes
description: Affects carbohydrate intake and insulin management; requires careful blood sugar monitoring and consistent meal planning.

name: Type 2 Diabetes
description: Requires reduced sugar and refined carbs; promotes high-fiber, low-glycemic foods and weight management.

name: Hypertension
description: Necessitates a low-sodium diet; emphasizes fruits, vegetables, and whole grains (e.g., DASH diet).

name: Hypothyroidism
description: May benefit from sufficient iodine, selenium, and limiting goitrogens; supports balanced, low-calorie diet for weight control.

name: Hyperthyroidism
description: Often requires higher calorie intake due to increased metabolism; may benefit from calcium and vitamin D support.

name: Celiac Disease
description: Requires strict gluten-free diet; avoidance of wheat, barley, rye, and cross-contaminated foods is essential.

name: Lactose Intolerance
description: Requires avoidance of lactose-containing dairy; can use lactose-free or plant-based alternatives.

name: Food Allergy
description: Requires complete elimination of allergenic foods (e.g., peanuts, shellfish); careful label reading is necessary.

name: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
description: Benefits from anti-inflammatory diet; may require avoiding gluten or soy and ensuring adequate nutrients like selenium.

name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome
description: Often involves low-FODMAP diet; triggers vary and may include dairy, gluten, or high-fiber foods.

name: Anemia
description: Needs iron-rich foods and vitamin C for absorption; may involve limiting calcium near iron meals.

name: Obesity
description: Requires calorie reduction and nutrient-dense foods; portion control and physical activity are key.

name: High Cholesterol
description: Encourages low saturated fat intake; promotes fiber, omega-3s, and plant sterols.

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: Favors heart-healthy diet (e.g., Mediterranean); low in saturated fat and high in fruits and vegetables.

name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome
description: Supports low-GI, anti-inflammatory foods; may benefit from reduced dairy and processed carbs.

name: Depression
description: May benefit from omega-3s, B vitamins, and consistent meals; avoid excessive sugar and alcohol.

name: Anxiety Disorder
description: Balanced meals and stable blood sugar help; may benefit from magnesium and reducing caffeine.

name: Asthma
description: Diet rich in antioxidants and omega-3s may support management; avoid known triggers if food-related.

name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease
description: Requires avoiding trigger foods (e.g., spicy, acidic, fatty foods); smaller, frequent meals are recommended.

name: Arthritis
description: Anti-inflammatory diet with omega-3s and antioxidants can help; limit processed foods and added sugars.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
description: Controls protein, sodium, potassium, and phosphorus intake; fluid management important.

name: Liver Disease
description: May require low-sodium and high-protein diet; avoid alcohol and saturated fats.

name: Parkinson's Disease
description: Focus on fiber-rich foods to prevent constipation; adequate hydration needed.

name: Multiple Sclerosis
description: Balanced diet with vitamin D, omega-3s; manage fatigue with small, frequent meals.

name: Alzheimer's Disease
description: Supports antioxidant-rich foods; maintain stable blood sugar.

name: Epilepsy
description: Ketogenic diet may be prescribed; avoid foods that trigger seizures.

name: Osteoporosis
description: Calcium and vitamin D rich diet; limit caffeine and sodium.

name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
description: High-calorie, nutrient-dense foods; small, frequent meals to reduce breathlessness.

name: Fibromyalgia
description: Anti-inflammatory diet; avoid processed foods and sugars.

name: Gluten Ataxia
description: Strict gluten-free diet similar to celiac disease.

name: Gallstones
description: Low-fat diet; avoid rapid weight loss.

name: Pancreatitis
description: Low-fat diet; small, frequent meals.

name: Ulcerative Colitis
description: Low-residue diet during flare-ups; avoid trigger foods.

name: Crohn's Disease
description: Individualized diet; avoid high-fiber during flares.

name: Diverticulitis
description: Low-fiber diet during acute phase; high-fiber during remission.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: Anti-inflammatory foods; omega-3 fatty acids.

name: Psoriasis
description: Anti-inflammatory diet; avoid trigger foods.

name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
description: Balanced diet; vitamin D and calcium important.

name: Schizophrenia
description: Balanced meals; avoid excessive sugar and caffeine.

name: Bipolar Disorder
description: Consistent meal timing; omega-3 fatty acids.

name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
description: Balanced nutrient-dense foods; manage blood sugar.

name: Restless Leg Syndrome
description: Iron-rich diet; avoid caffeine.

name: Endometriosis
description: Anti-inflammatory diet; reduce processed foods.

name: Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
description: Balanced diet; avoid artificial additives.

name: Autism Spectrum Disorder
description: Individualized diet; may avoid gluten and casein.

name: Stroke Recovery
description: High-protein, nutrient-dense foods; manage blood pressure.

name: Heart Failure
description: Low-sodium diet; fluid restriction as needed.

name: Peripheral Artery Disease
description: Heart-healthy diet; avoid smoking and high cholesterol foods.

name: Non-Alcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
description: Weight management and reduced saturated fat intake; monitor sugar consumption.

name: Chronic Pancreatitis
description: Low-fat, easily digestible foods; avoid alcohol.

name: Anorexia Nervosa
description: High-calorie, nutrient-dense meals; monitor eating behavior closely.

name: Bulemia Nervosa
description: Balanced meals; focus on electrolyte and nutrient restoration.

name: Gout
description: Low-purine diet; limit red meat and alcohol.

name: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
description: Anti-inflammatory diet with omega-3s; balanced nutrition.

name: Wilson's Disease
description: Low copper diet; avoid shellfish, nuts, chocolate.

name: Phenylketonuria
description: Strict low-phenylalanine diet; medical formula supplementation.

name: Cystic Fibrosis
description: High-calorie, high-fat diet; enzyme supplementation often needed.

name: Pregnancy
description: Balanced diet with folic acid, iron, calcium; avoid certain fish and alcohol.

name: Lactation
description: Increased calorie and fluid needs; focus on nutrient-dense foods.

name: Infant Nutrition
description: Age-appropriate complementary feeding; avoid allergens early.

name: Eating Disorders
description: Individualized nutrition therapy; psychological support important.

name: Chronic Migraine
description: Avoid trigger foods (e.g., tyramine, caffeine); maintain hydration.

name: Post-Surgical Nutrition
description: High-protein, nutrient-dense foods; tailored to surgery type.

name: Vitamin D Deficiency
description: Increase vitamin D-rich foods and safe sun exposure.

name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
description: Increase B12-rich foods; supplementation often necessary.

name: Iron Deficiency
description: Iron-rich diet plus vitamin C to enhance absorption.

name: Zinc Deficiency
description: Foods rich in zinc; supplements if needed.

name: Magnesium Deficiency
description: Magnesium-rich foods; consider supplements.
